snippet: The cabinet approved a hotly debated bill on Wednesday that gives parents of toddlers an allowance for keeping their children out of state-run day care.
abstract: German cabinet approves a hotly debated bill that gives parents of toddlers an allowance for keeping their children out of state-run day care; critics say the bill will derail recent efforts to encourage German women to return to work after starting a family.
lead_paragraph: The cabinet approved a hotly debated bill on Wednesday that gives parents of toddlers an allowance for keeping their children out of state-run day care.

headline.seo: Germany Considers Subsidies for Non-State Child Care
headline.main: German Lawmakers Spar Over Child Care Subsidy
headline.print_headline: Germany Weighs Stipend for Parents to Pay for Child Care
